meanings.definition: The quality or state of being talkative or chatty.
meanings.sent1: Her gabbiness made it hard to focus during class discussions.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy her gabbiness at social gatherings; she always has interesting stories to share.
meanings.sent3: Despite her gabbiness, she managed to keep the secret party plans a surprise.
meanings.sent4: The gabbiness of the birds in the morning filled the air with lively chatter.
meanings.sent5: His gabbiness was like a bubbling brook, constantly flowing with words.

meanings.sent1: The teacher had to address the student's gabbiness in class.
meanings.sent2: Her gabbiness during the meeting was distracting and prolonged the discussion.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's gabbiness entertained the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The gabbiness of the old radio host was a comforting sound in the quiet night.
meanings.sent5: The gabbiness of the salesman was so persuasive that I ended up buying more than I needed.
